panels.description: The number of Teleport services connected to an Auth Service instance, grouped by version.
panels.title: Connected Teleport Versions

panels.description: Count and version of connected Teleport agents.
panels.title: Connected Teleport Versions

panels.description:
- Number of user logins
- Number of failed `tsh login` or `tsh ssh` logins
panels.title: Login Count

panels.description: Number of resources connected to the Teleport Cluster.
panels.title: Connected Resources

panels.description: Number of reverse SSH tunnels connected to the Teleport Proxy Service by Teleport instances.
panels.title: Tunnels

panels.description:
The rollout state aggregates the state of every group. It becomes active as soon as the first group is updated, and done when the last group is updated.

The operator makes update decisions based on this state. For example, if there is an unstarted v1 -> v2 rollout and you want to update to v3, the operator will choose to do v1 -> v3 instead of v2 -> v3.
panels.title: Rollout State

panels.description:
Percentage of write requests to the backend that succeed.

---

A Teleport cluster cannot function if the Auth Service does not have a healthy cluster state backend.
You need to track the ability of the Auth Service to read from and write to its backend.

If your backend becomes unavailable, you can investigate your backend infrastructure.

targets.expr:
1 - ((
        sum by ($metrics_per) (rate(backend_write_requests_failed_total{component="backend",namespace="$namespace",job=~"$teleport_job"}[$__rate_interval]))
        - 
        sum by ($metrics_per) (rate(teleport_backend_write_requests_failed_precondition_total{component="backend",namespace="$namespace",job=~"$teleport_job"}[$__rate_interval])) OR on() vector(0)
    ) / (
        sum by ($metrics_per) (rate(backend_write_requests_total{component="backend",namespace="$namespace",job=~"$teleport_job"}[$__rate_interval]))
    ))

panels.title: Backend Write Availability

panels.description:
Percentage of read requests to the backend that succeed.

---

A Teleport cluster cannot function if the Auth Service does not have a healthy cluster state backend.
You need to track the ability of the Auth Service to read from and write to its backend.

If your backend becomes unavailable, you can investigate your backend infrastructure.

targets.expr:
1- ((
    (
        (sum by ($metrics_per) (rate(backend_read_requests_failed_total{component="backend",namespace="$namespace"}[$__rate_interval])) OR vector(0))
            /
        (sum by ($metrics_per) (rate(backend_read_requests_total{component="backend",namespace="$namespace"}[$__rate_interval])))
    )
  )) or group by ($metrics_per) (rate(backend_read_requests_total{component="backend",namespace="$namespace"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Backend Read Availability

panels.description:
Count of successful and failed backend requests.

During failed backend writes, a Teleport process also increments the `Precondition failed` metric if the cause of the failure is expected. For example, the metric increments during a create operation if a record already exists, during an update or delete operation if the record is not found, and during an atomic write if the resource was modified concurrently. All of these conditions can occur in a well-functioning Teleport cluster.
panels.title: [[backend_metrics]]

panels.description:
- Number of audit events emitted.
- Number of times emitting audit events failed.
panels.title: Audit Events

panels.description:
Resident memory size in bytes.

If available, [GOMEMLIMIT](https://pkg.go.dev/runtime) is shown as a dotted line.
panels.title: Memory

panels.description: Number of goroutines that currently exist.
panels.title: Goroutines

panels.description:
Total user and system CPU time spent in seconds.

If available, the [GOMAXPROCS](https://pkg.go.dev/runtime) value is shown as a dotted line.
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: Total number of RPCs completed on the server, regardless of success or failure.
panels.title: RPC Invocations Handled

panels.description: Total number of RPCs completed on the server, with a non-OK status code.
panels.title: RPC Invocation Failures

list.description: For per-instance metrics show metrics based on `pod` label if available, otherwise use `instance` label.
